definitions.text: a hypothetical description of a complex entity or process
examples: the computer program was based on a model of the circulatory and respiratory systems
his car was an old model

definitions.text: a person who poses for a photographer or painter or sculptor
examples: the president didn't have time to be a model so the artist worked from photos

definitions.text: representation of something (sometimes on a smaller scale)

examples: he is the very model of a modern major general
every child needs a role model

definitions.text: a woman who wears clothes to display fashions
examples: she was too fat to be a mannequin

definitions.text: the act of representing something (usually on a smaller scale)
plan or create according to a model or models
assume a posture as for artistic purposes
examples: We don't know the woman who posed for Leonardo so often

definitions.text: create a representation or model of
examples: The pilots are trained in conditions simulating high-altitude flights
